meanings.definition: A device or instrument used to calibrate or adjust another device or instrument.
meanings.sent1: The technician used the calibrator to make sure the scale was accurate.
meanings.sent2: The calibrator helped ensure the thermometer was working correctly.
meanings.sent3: The calibrator and the scale had a dance-off to see who was more precise.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was like a calibrator, fine-tuning every aspect of the project.
meanings.sent5: The calibrator hummed softly as it perfected the measurement.

meanings.definition: A person who calibrates or adjusts devices or instruments.
meanings.sent1: The skilled calibrator adjusted the machine with precision.
meanings.sent2: The calibrator arrived promptly to fix the broken equipment.
meanings.sent3: The calibrator joked that even robots need a little tune-up now and then.
meanings.sent4: His expertise as a calibrator was like magic, making everything work smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The calibrator's steady hands were known throughout the factory.
